question: Which water body lies to the south of the country Benin?
explanation: The coastline involving the Gulf of Guinea consists of two parts - (a). the Bight of Benin and (b). the Bight of Bonny (the Bight of Biafra). The country Benin lies adjacent to Bight of Benin part of the Gulf of Guinea. The Gulf of Guinea lies in the Atlantic Ocean along the western African coast. It lies in the intersection of the equator and the prime meridian.
